page.title: 03Coal Mining
page.content: There has been coalmining at Heather for many years. It is thought that people mined coal as far back as the fourteenth century. These mines were usually deep, and had shafts and tunnels. Today coal is mined at Heather in a different way because we have an opencast mine. We visited the opencast site and we collected lots of information about the way coal is mined today. Today they mine twenty thousand tons a week, but in the recent miners' strike they actually mined more than this. The mine was not on strike at this time. The deepest hole they have dug from for coal is 100 metres deep. A lot of the people working at the mine work for private contractors who do a lot of the work. They have two very big draglines.
